item.title: GADTs By Use Cases
item.description: This workshop will be presented at ScalaIO 2019, in Lyon (France), on Tuesday the 29th of October at 9am. Welcome. This session will introduce you to a very powerful tool in programming. Whereas most introduction start by presenting its theoretical foundations in a very formal way, we chose to present it via short examples and practical use cases. This workshop is made of three parts. The last one presents three of the most valuable use cases.

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome to stefshine’s playground Hello dear visitor, my name is StÃ©phane TANKOUA. I’m a software engineer keen on programming, especially functional programming. I’m a scala fluent (I think) programmer, a haskell wannabe. On this blog I will share with you some interesting thoughts I’ve been througth during my journey of learning functional programming and type systems. Come and say hi on Twitter where I sometimes express some thoughts. You can see some of the ugly things I do on my Github page.

item.title: Hello Word Post
item.description: Hello Word Post Here is a simple Hello Word app in Scala: object Main extends App { def main(args: Array[String]): Unit = println("Hello World") } And in Haskell: module Main where main :: IO () main = putStrLn "Hello World" It was tough, isn’t it ? That’s all for the joke, we will see more interesting things in the next posts.
